Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for an "airport" hotel”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: We were excited to know that there was an airport hotel for our late night arrival to and very early departure from IST. When we landed at 9:00 PM and followed the signs in the international terminal for TAV Airport Hotel, we were led out a door to a curb. We asked around when there were no more signs and they told us to walk to the other end of the terminal on the curb. When we did, we found that there was a phone to call the shuttle. What?? Why take a shuttle when it is listed as Terminal 1?? We called, got the shuttle, and it took us just around the corner to the hotel. Sure enough, it is connected to Terminal 1, but there is no way you can get there by foot, which is ridiculous. That defeats the sole purpose of an airport hotel; you should be able to get there easily inside the terminal. Once there the rooms were very clean, but the noise inside the hotel and outside the windows (two men talked very loudly at 1:00 AM) made it difficult to sleep. All in all, I would say it is an average airport hotel due to the inconvenience of its location and the noise factor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you don't wanna waste time”
Reviews.Author: Andreea2503
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 4-5 times in the last 2 years. I always take a room when I have at least 5 hours between flights. One doesn't have to get out of the airport as its easy accessible from the duty free area. That's perfect. Check-in and check-out are really fast and the staff friendly enough. Rooms are very clean and quite big. You get everything you need in the room, kettle and coffee and tea included.Unfortunately the walls are rather thin so you can hear your neighbors. However if you wish to change the room all you have to do is call the reception. One can take a room for a minimum of 3 hours and that costs about 95 euros. Up to 6 hours the price is about 130 euros.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: Zayna_Megh
Reviews.Content: saw it by chance during 18 hour transit. Tried to rest in the public bedroom provided, but it does not look very welcoming. with people talking at the top of their voices. Walked around after given the meal ticket and Glad to have chance upon TAV and gave us a good shower and rest. I cant remember how much it cost, probably about USD250. Very clean rooms and super big bed. If ever we have to transit in Turkey, this would be our resting place.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find it at first”
Reviews.Author: J P
Reviews.Content: We'd booked at the airside part of the hotel but after the long-haul from Bangkok we must have been too groggy to find it, because in the end, not having seen any signs indicating where it was, we found ourselves outside the terminal. At that point I rang the hotel and in due course we found our way to the other part of the hotel, outside the terminal, where we did not have a reservation but they found us a spacious, clean and comfortable room quite quickly. It was a convenient location for an overnight stopover; a bit pricey but the staff were friendly and it was a short walk from the terminal. A rather bare minibar but on the other hand the wireless internet access was free.

Reviews.Title: “overvalued but good”
Reviews.Author: Sradin
Reviews.Content: If you have whole night in Istanbul definetely you should be going for other nearby otels, it is over valued. But rooms are very nice, service is good and it is a great advantage to stay near airport.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Senol84
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night to get to my flight early in the morning. There is a free shuttle in every 15 minutes. We used it to get to the hotel and the airport. The hotel is in the airport. If you have a flight and need to spend some time around airport, this hotel is the best option. Check-in, chec-out took very short time. Rooms are really large and clean. TV was big and furnutire was new. Sleep quality is ok. However walls are really thin and you can hear the next room very clearly. Breakfast was ok. You see the aircrafts and passengers while you are having your breakfast; interesting view. Staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport the top”
Reviews.Author: EmanueleL81
Reviews.Content: I stay in the TAV Airport Hotel one night during my transfer from Istanbul to another place of Turkish..the hotel is very nice, wonderfull, there is a free bus that it take you from/to hotel-airport every 15 minutes, the rooms in the hotel are very excellent room, cleaned and they are all of confort. There aren't any noise and during the night you can sleep very very good even though it is situated behind the airport. I'm sure I will come back in the TAV Airport for every travelling in Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms clean and well decorated”
Reviews.Author: Nunoleitaooo
Reviews.Content: Big rooms clean white lines with modern style. Very nice ambient with good service. Ideal to rest in aeroport night. You will enjoy!!!! I loved....

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Convenience”
Reviews.Author: JandJ8294
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned home separately from Beirut with an overnight in Istanbul. We were both so pleased to have a bit of time to rest our weary heads before enduring the long flight home. We were picked up within ten minutes after arrival (immediately telephone access to hotel at pick-up site). The hotel is perfectly clean, perfectly comfortable and almost perfectly efficient. I had a five a.m. flight and left a 2:00 a.m. wake up call, which I did not get until 3:30 a.m. In a whirlwind I made it to the gate at 4:30 a.m. I strongly suggest not trusting verbal communication. Write down your essential time needs. Something was lost in translation. Yet, I would unhestatingly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, close to airport...”
Reviews.Author: DevaDave27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice this week the first night was after a long delay, the restaurant serves food till 11.30 pm which is handy after a shapooh day. The staff are friendly and helpful, ringing the ferry company to check my onward journey was ok. The restaurant looks out over gate 220 and 221 so you get to see the organised chaos of the planes coming in and out, the Efes beer is 11 TLR a bottle which is just under Â£5 a bottle! Breakfast is a buffet style with plenty of choice, and my favorite the honey still in the wooden frame. Expensive?? well had 2 course dinner and 3 bottles of beer and the night stay was around 330 TLR a night which is Â£130 ish

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, extremely unfriendly staff but the room was really nice”
Reviews.Author: Regina H
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed in this hotel very often but since 2008 the staff is becoming very rude to the hotel guests. I like this hotel because it is very convenient specially for transit passangers but now I will look for another hotel. The last time IÂ´ve been there was 3 weeks ago and the reception was so cold and unfriendly I felt like an unwelcome guest. I even asked if there is any problem and they didnÂ´t even answer my question. By checking out the same situation and the receptionist gave me no invoice and treated me as I wasnÂ´t there, I was so upset and under stress, I was as nervous as I checked in and I wanted to relax and enjoy my stay there. This kind of treatment made change my mind and stay in another hotel next time. By all the comfort I want to be treated with respect. This hotel must learn that "to be friendly" is also a part of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but convenient”
Reviews.Author: scbc
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It has a clean, welcoming feel about it and the rooms are extremely spacious. Access is easy by calling on a direct line for their minibus just outside the terminal exit, or by walking through the underground connection via the Metro station. Transit passengers also have access to the hotel from the transit lounge. At 135 Euro per night for a double, it's expensive, but then again, so is staying elsewhere in Istanbul, without the worry of transportation in this bustling city. The breakfast buffet is outstanding, and in my most recent stay, included smoked veal tongue, lentil soup, camenbert and gouda cheeses, eggs made to order, grilled tomatoes with cheddar and an amazing variety of jams, juices and spreads. All of this was also extremely elegantly presented, with individual porcelain coffee pots brought to the table. When I requested internet access (for my iphone), a laptop was delivered to the room, and reception was happy to do our flight check in from the front desk. Bear in mind that the old wing (without windows) is/was the smoking section but has excellent artificial lighting where the windows would normally and the lighting can be adjusted depending on one's body clock. The new wing is completely non-smoking, and has a very modern decor, including orthopedic pillows, flat screen TV, parquet floors, ultra light comforters, see-through minibar, and complimentary coffee and tea. I was not able to adjust the thermostat (it was far too warm) but do not fault the hotel as I fell asleep before asking for assistance. I did receive an unsolicited wake up call which I wasn't happy about but these things happen. Given the cost of boutique hotels in Sultanahmet,and the very easy access from TAV via public transportation to all of Istanbul, I would choose to stay here again even with the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: skoddehauk
Reviews.Content: I frequently have an early flight out of Istanbul after my visits to the city. The TAV airport hotel was a pleasant surprise and amongst the better airport hotels I have stayed at recently. Very close to the terminal, large rooms and breakfast available at 4 am makes the TAV a very good substitute for the 5 am taxi rides from the city to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Little pricey,but an excellent hotel for transit stay.”
Reviews.Author: Urojahaji
Reviews.Content: We were in transit in IST for about 9 hours. Instead of trying our luck in the lounges, we chose to stay here. The common area in the transit lounge does not offer comfortable chairs. The hotel entrance is from the transit area. You do not have to head out of passport control. They over hourly rates. We took the 3-6 hour option for about 185 dollars. The room was very clean and nicely lit. All the amenities of a nice hotel was there. You can take a shower and freshen up before the next flight. Also a good option if you are traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Airside is an option - but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Gerry96
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the option of staying inside the transit/departure area, If you have an early flight this can be an attractive option as it will save you the visa and passport control queues on arrival and all the hassle of security, check-in, passport control etc. when going back for your flight. (The airport is at its busiest around 6/7 a.m.) Hower it is not a cheap option; rooms are sold in blocs of 3 hours, 6 hours etc. and if you want a full night's sleep, the 9+ hour option will set you back about â‚¬180. You can stay in some fine places in Istanbul for that sort of money. Also there are no hotel facilities airside, other than an uninspiring room service menu. Otherwise your dining option is the Departure area Food Court. The hotel's other amenities, such as the fitness centre are also "off limits" airside. The rooms are OK and well insulated from aircraft noise but the night I stayed there, a construction crew was having a competition as to who could shout loudest and drop the most pieces of metal pipe. It seemed to go on most of the night. I think in future I will forego the few hours sleep gained by staying airside and use a more interesting and better value hotel in Yesilkoy or elsewhere nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You can't get nearer to the terminal!”
Reviews.Author: Cliff C
Reviews.Content: What a great location.It took us 5 mins to walk to the terminal from the hotel reception. If you have an early morning flight this hotel is a must!. the staff were very friendly and food was very nice -breakfast starts at 4am so you can be sure of getting something to eat however early you start.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient place to stay at the airport”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRickc
Reviews.Content: If you are transiting through this hotel, it is not a bad place to stay. A few things to keep in mind- you have to take a shuttle to the hotel, as it is only connected to the international terminal (post check-in). Also keep in mind that the walls are paper thin and you can hear people walking on the floor above your room

Reviews.Title: “Better than past Reviews”
Reviews.Author: TerryGranade
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the older reviews I wasn't sure. But the location out-weighed the negatives. We had our guide in Ephesus call during the day and found out the is a shuttle to the hotel from the Istanbul domestic terminal. We were leaving the next day back to Texas and wanted the convenience. If you leave baggage claim go directly out the door and over the first lane of traffic is the tour bus, shuttle lane, Look to the left of the large support pole is a gray phone with TAV shuttle on it. Pick it up, dial first number button, and connect to front desk. They will send the shuttle. About 8-10 minutes time. Check in was was breeze, will had told them late check in, 11PM, and went directly to our King size rooms. Large, clean, comfortable with numerous amenities. The bar was closed but, room service waited on us in the bar. After wine and Jack Daniels off to a nice hot shower. Next morning breakfast with eggs to order was included in the room price. Stay on the side of the hotel away from the tarmac to the airport. Even numbered rooms. A shuttle carried us back to th International terminal with no problems. Right up to Delta Airlines check in with no walking. I saw a complaint about security check in to access the hotel. You're on the tarmac of the airport people, what do you expect. Side note, the curios from the restaurant are very well priced and better then downtown. Three couples were very happy and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnighter but not totally convenient”
Reviews.Author: luxury-lizard
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night after flying into IST late one evening and out early the following morning. We found the hotel's web site quite confusing about the difference between the airside and land-side hotel. In any case since we were arriving on a domestic flight we booked land-side (I could not even figure out how to book airside) - after e-mailing the hotel we figured out where to get their shuttle - very easy - immediately out side both the domestic and the international exits and well marked. The shuttle was waiting when we arrived so we had no problem there. The ride to the hotel was longer than we expected - due to the route required as opposed to the actual distance. The front-desk staff were friendly and helpful. The whole appearance of the lobby and hallways is very much like a public service office building - very dreary but our room was large, modern and clean; the pillows were hard. While the room rate was quite high (167 EUR without breakfast), the mini-bar prices were probably the cheapest in Turkey, perhaps the world. The only issue was when we went to leave for the international terminal at 6am, we were told that the shuttle was full and we would need to wait for it to complete a round-trip. As a result we were in a bit of a panic about making our flight as there were extensive queues at the airport. The front desk person offered us a complimentary breakfast while we waited (about 10-15 minutes). We made our flight with only 30 minutes to spare but all's well than ends well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for early flight”
Reviews.Author: blondie4908
Reviews.Content: I wasn't so sure about this hotel based on its website but we were pleasantly surprised. It is a short shuttle ride to the hotel. The rooms are spacious, very clean and modern. They were very accommodating to our needs. It is a little pricey but it worth it if you have a early flight. The breakfast in the morning is quite impressive and you can sit and watch planes while eating. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a close up view of your plane!”
Reviews.Author: mihgan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on the 1st of August on a long lay over from Spain. The one we stayed in was as called "the land side" one. You have to actually get your visa on arrival to the airport and go through immigration officially enter Turkey. There is a convenient bus that is clearly marked for hotel residents and it takes you to the hotel front door. The view from the restaurant was great if you are a plane spotter. You can also see flight times and gate numbers since the hotel has a link to airport computers. As we were there for only a day I wanted to make the most of it and the staff were very helpful in this respect. They advised on a day trip with a tour bus that was available for the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “No pets allowed”
Reviews.Author: MarySL00
Reviews.Content: Staff at the reception desk was not flexible: no pets were allowed, not even in their cage.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable for one night”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our 11 day Turkey vacation with staying at the TAV airport hotel the night before we were to fly home to Los Angeles. We flown in to Istanbul from the Denizli Cardak airport at around 9pm. There is a free shuttle bus to the hotel, but we had a very hard time finding it initially. There was a sign outside (TAV hotel shuttle bus) but difficult to find. The shuttle bus is actually a mini-Van and apparently drives by every 10minutes, but we waited at least 20min with the help of a nice man who called the hotel for us. When we got there, we were annoyed by the fact that we had to go through security to enter the hotel!!!! Went through a metal detector and had our luggage scanned! The front desk staff stated that it is the aiport's security and not the hotel's, but I'm wondering why it's even in use when we're actually already out of the main airport??? Anyhow, good thing the rooms were nice, modern, clean, well appointed with bathroom amenities, free bottle water with coffee/tea packages, and free wireless. Breakfast starts at 4am with tea/coffee!!! no window though.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but pricey”
Reviews.Author: mcwcBaku
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and two young children. We took a triple room and added a bed. The hotel is right inside the terminal so no hassle with passports. Check-in very easy. NIce big rooms with all amenities. If you stay 9 hours it's one price, after that even higher. But it has everything you need to sleep comfortably, which is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kadi-rei
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room (no 418): spacious, comfortable. All is here what needed: cupboard, minibar, safety box, free wifi, free coffee+tea+water, tv, room service. Lovely bathroom, soft towels, quality shampoo, conditioner, gel, lotion, hair dryer :) If needed they provide shaving tools etc. Really nice and quiet!! free shuttle to and from airport- 2min! I came here for 7h, as didnt feel waiting in the airport 9h for my next flight. It cost me 80eur, but its worth it, Im very satisfied and I am picky:) Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just inside the International airport terminal.”
Reviews.Author: IndiaEuroreisen
Reviews.Content: I took a Turkish airline flight to Istanbul and had a transit time of more than 20hours. Because of some reason, I needed a hotel near airport and this hotel inside the airport came handy for my stay. Even one can stay here taking a Turkish Visa (even though its not that costly) The service personal offered a warm gesture with excellent breakfast. Rooms were on par with a five star hotel. Of-course its a five star hotel. I can recommend this hotel for any transit passenger, who wish to catch flight in odd timings.

Reviews.Title: “SUperb location, unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerTom
Reviews.Content: The hotel has two parts: inside the terminal and outside the terminal. Outside is nothing special, and does not bring a lot of added value. Inside the terminal it is in an excellent location if you need to catch an early morning flight. The hotel has large rooms with showers. Rating would be 3 start, but as everywhere in Turkey it is probably rated as 4 or 5 star. Staff is unfriendly and not helpful. But again, you are not there for the staff but to get some sleep before the early flight. Inside the terminal no breakfast is serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient choice if you desperately need some shut-eye...”
Reviews.Author: chaimdan
Reviews.Content: I had a 7 hour stop over in IST and planned on just sticking around the terminal... When we landed we couldn't find any quiet places and the airport was very hot and the kids were getting restless so we decided to try the hotel. It's located within the terminal, so it's super convenient but also very pricey... we paid 140 Euro for 3-6 hours.. more hours = more money... I was very happy with the room... nice, clean and spacious. It got a little hot at one point, I called the front desk and they said there is nothing they can do as it's the same AC the airport has and they don't control it. thankfully it cooled off... overall I recommend this place if you need some quiet time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jebby
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for an airside room since we had a 8:20 AM flight from Istanbul to Frankfurt with a transfer to a flight to Chicago. However, when we tried to check in to Turkish Airlines for the flight we were told we could not until the AM because of special securities to the US. Thus we could not use the airside room. The hotel gave us a room on the landside which is a different building; one needed to get the hotel van but it took more than 30 minutes for the van to come. The land side building has both windowless and windowed rooms so request what is acceptable for you. The room [windowed] was large, modern, quiet and had all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient but dirty”
Reviews.Author: oldpo
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 22 in room 107. Choose this hotel to avoid potential problems with 3 a.m. Istanbul taxi ride to airport. Hotel is quite new and is part of airport building. Rooms were large and sound suppressing worked effectively. Staff were cordial and helpful. Upon check-in noted that there was no hot water. Reported this problem to front desk 3 times, then went to bed, water at that point was tepid. Night manager reduced bill by 20 Euro and provided free breakfast bar for hot water problem. Likely hot water problem was unusual event. Not resolved was dirty room issue. Floor needed thorough cleaning, bathroom tile had fungus growing around tub (see pictures). Had spent previous 13 days in Turkey, staying in many rooms far more modest, none were as ill-kept as this one. Reported the problem by paper and e-mail, no response from corporate owners BTA. Could be a nice place if housekeeping improved, but clearly not worth USD $160 (after hot water discount).

Reviews.Title: “You can walk to here from the terminal”
Reviews.Author: lowmaintenanceBrit
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good value. We chose this one as it's right next to the terminal and you can get there on foot. After following one of the big airport subway passages to its very end, you then walk up a short flight of steps, out into the edge of a carpark, and then get onto the road that leads into the hotel entrance (which is a few hundred yards away, and visible). No need to wait for a shuttle, no crossing major roads to get there - very easy, even with heavy suitcases and not a word of Turkish!

Reviews.Title: “Hassle-free Hospitality in the Airport”
Reviews.Author: cdafloathouse
Reviews.Content: Because of an early flight, we wanted to be close to the airport without the hassle of shuttles, calls, breakfast, etc. This hotel is in the airport, built under on of the extended concourses. They offer a convenient shuttle (a 3 minute drive) or the option of walking through a tunnel, exiting near the hotel entrance. The rooms are soundproof, commodious, full of extras (including orthopedic pillows). Breakfast (Turkish or European) is served from 4:00 am in their dining room with linens and a waiter. It was superb. The shuttle driver not only took us to departures, he walked us and our baggage cart through the airport maze and to the British Airways counter. Rooms around $200. The calm was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Clean Hotel, But A Little Expensive”
Reviews.Author: LukChang
Reviews.Content: There are two parts to this hotel. I stayed at the one inside the departures terminal as I had several hours to kill between flights. I was slightly confused about so many negative reports, until I realized the majority of the reports were for the hotel that is just outside the terminal building. The one inside is a short walk from the departure gates, 5 minutes gets you to most gates. Check in was friendly & despite turning up without a reservation, the hotel was full at the time. Told to come back after 1 hour. Just enough time for a Starbucks coffee, right outside the entrance. Check in was quick, room was already cleaned so no more waiting & because I had stayed there several times in the past they had completed most of the registration card. Just had to sign & confirm departure time. The room was light with a huge window looking out onto the other side of the Airport Hotel. Donâ€™t know if I am lucky or paying extra but every time I stay in this hotel I get a window. Bed is really comfortable & the room quite so a good sleep is possible. Reception staff are friendly & very helpful. I needed a socket adapter to recharge my laptop. Within seconds one was brought to my room. When I checked out I handed it back & no problem. Other hotels have tried to charge me rental or even to buy yet another one at over inflated prices. Been inside the airport there are plenty of food and beverage places open all the time offering a wide selection of food. The only down side for me is that the hotel can work out to be expensive especially if staying for a short time. It cost over $180 for 6 hours, but when the other option is sitting in cafÃ©â€™s or bars then its worth the money. For a reasonable length layover its worth paying just to have a bit of privacy, shower & sleep before another long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you have an early flight!!”
Reviews.Author: horadam1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our Turkey trip. When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly staff. We were informed that breakfast began at 4am. When we told them that we had to be at the airiport by 4am, they actually had their staff start earlier and arranged for us to have continental breakfast at 3:30am!! The rooms were nice and clean, but no windows which was weird, but I understand the airport is just outside. For 1 night, it was fine. I would definitely stay here again if needing an early flight. The staff here are excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but not the service”
Reviews.Author: LiviaDrusilla11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, room and bathroom were big, the bed very comfortable. Indeed there are no windows, if you are claustrophobic you might feel trapped inside. We stay at this hotel regularly, when we travel via Istanbul, so we always wanted to come back. But our last stay left us with an unpleasant feel about it. The staff was more than rude, all of them. They have called us 10 minutes before check out time to remind us, then again 5 minutes before, well if I waste my time to answer their "get out of our hotel" calls, I will very likely be late for check out! When we were heading out the door, about 2 min before check out time, the phone rang again. We did not bother to answer and we went straight out. At the reception we were treated as if we are the ones that did something wrong. Half sentences and monosyllabic answers. I believe this is not the way to do business, when someone comes to visit you, you do not chase them out the door. After all, it is our money and the hotel administration stated clearly that if we are staying over our check out time limit, an extra amount will be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Good for early departures - request airside room”
Reviews.Author: Mariehamn
Reviews.Content: For the businessman that has late meetings and early departure next morning the Istanbul airport hotel might be worth trying. Make sure, though, you get an AIRSIDE ROOM (cannot be emphazised enough - otherwise you miss the whole idea with the hotel!!!) to be on the right side of passport/security controls in the morning. In the evening, checkin is easy and also passport and security controls are without queues! The rooms are next to the gates, so from bed to gate it's a matter of minutes. From my arrival to the airport (23.00), it took me some eight minutes from the main building's entrance doors to the check-in desk at the hotel! Including flight check-in, security and passport control!!! Rooms are, however, without windows. And you will experience some annoying noise from trucks passing by just outside the room's outer (window-less) wall. But it's all worth it when the alarm bell rings just 40 minutes before departure! I didn't have breakfast - so I cannot comment on that one... Looked ok, though. Ps. Try the shoe polish in the check-in area. Cheaper than in the business districts and extremely well done!

Reviews.Title: “breakfast good”
Reviews.Author: peachgrove
Reviews.Content: 1, Shuttle bus Outside of the international terminal, there is a flip sign for this hotel. But you need a ask the hotel for a shuttlle to come. The shuttle is a black van, with a sign of the hotel name on its front glass, so it's easy to identify. Just a 5 minutes ride to the hotel. 2, Front desk Friendly, English is OK. 3,Room My room had no windows, so it was imposible to find out what is going outside. There were no sounds of aircraft. Unfortunately many of this hotel's guests takes very early flight in the morning, so that I was waked up by next room's morning call. There were so many morning calls near my room so that every time I got wake up. 4,Breakfast Very good. Many choices, good taste. The women who served in the restraunt was very friendly. Also it was very helpful that it starts from 4:00 a.m. in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property”
Reviews.Author: Ilove2Travell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another hotel in Istanbul and the room there was very small compared to this fullsized room at the airport. It is not quite connected to the airport but it is about a 5 minute walk to the airport and have to go through security at the airport. my colleague had 2 double beds and I had a king bed. It was a beautiful hote, clean, no noise what-so-ever and wake up calls were very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “A great palce to crash for the night”
Reviews.Author: shahzeeshan
Reviews.Content: As I had to catch an early morning flight to Kayseri a day after I arrived in Istanbul, I stayed at the Istanbul International Airport Hotel and was not disappointed. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly, and the rooms were immaculately clean and quiet. Quiet to the extent that you do not hear any noise from the airplanes taking off or landing. Also the restaurant in the lobby is neat as you get a view of the tarmac and airport. The only drawback to the hotel was the price which was close to $300 a night. A few words of caution though, if you book through the hotel make sure to bring your confirmaiton number with you as the front desk might not be able to find your reservation by your name. Also there is no entrance to the hotel from the airport (even though it is part of the terminal), and you can not walk to the airport either. But the airport shuttle is parked right outside of the international arrivals terminal. Make sure to look out for the black van parked next to the sign which clearly says "Istanbul International Airport Hotel" on it. But overall this a great hotel to crash for the night if you have to catch an early morning flight or connection.

HotelInfo.Name: TAV Airport Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: International Terminal 1, Istanbul 34831, Turkey
